snippet: The Playboy Club’s opening in Goa this winter inspires questions about women, tolerance, propriety in India, and of course, what the bunnies will wear.
abstract: Planned opening of Playboy Club opening in Goa, India, inspires questions about women, tolerance and propriety in India; most burning question, however, is about what the bunnies will wear--the traditional cleavage-baring bunny costume originally designed by Hugh Hefner in 1960 will obviously have to be abandoned.
lead_paragraph: The Playboy Club’s opening in Goa this winter inspires questions about women, tolerance, propriety in India, and of course, what the bunnies will wear.

headline.seo: Playboy Bunny Makeover for India Opening
headline.main: Bunny Makeover for a New Locale
headline.print_headline: Bunny Makeover For a New Locale
